meanings.definition: The quality or state of being infeasible.
meanings.sent1: The infeasibility of the plan was evident from the start.
meanings.sent2: The team recognized the infeasibility of completing the project on time.
meanings.sent3: Despite their best efforts, the infeasibility of the task made them laugh.
meanings.sent4: The infeasibility of reaching the summit seemed like trying to touch the sky.
meanings.sent5: The infeasibility of finding a needle in a haystack was a common phrase in their village.

meanings.definition: The inability to be carried out or accomplished.
meanings.sent1: She faced the infeasibility of fixing the broken vase.
meanings.sent2: The infeasibility of winning the game was disappointing for the team.
meanings.sent3: The infeasibility of teaching a fish to climb a tree was a humorous thought.
meanings.sent4: The infeasibility of stopping time felt like an impossible dream.
meanings.sent5: The infeasibility of holding water in a sieve was a lesson in futility.
